metadata.Title: CVE-2022-48063 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
GNU Binutils before 2.40 was discovered to contain an excessive memoryconsumption vulnerability via the function load_separate_debug_files atdwarf2.c. The attacker could supply a crafted ELF file and cause a DNSattack.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-48063` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

binutils - 2.24-5ubuntu14.2+esm5
binutils-multiarch - 2.24-5ubuntu14.2+esm5
binutils-source - 2.24-5ubuntu14.2+esm5
binutils-static - 2.24-5ubuntu14.2+esm5
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: binutils package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.24-5ubuntu14.2+esm5').
